org.processmining.plugins.guidetreeminer.swingx

Class DocumentWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • org.processmining.plugins.guidetreeminer.swingx.DocumentWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DocumentWriter
extends java.io.Writer
    An Writer implementation that places it's output in a swing text model (Document). The Document can be either a plain text or styled document implementation. If styled, the attributes assigned to the output stream will be used in the display of the output.
    Author:
    Timothy Prinzing

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.Writer

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DocumentWriter(javax.swing.text.Document doc)
      Constructs an output stream that will output to the given document with whatever the default attributes are.
      DocumentWriter(javax.swing.text.Document doc, javax.swing.text.AttributeSet a)
      Constructs an output stream that will output to the given document with the given set of character attributes.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Flush the stream. If the stream has saved any characters from the various write() methods in a buffer, write them immediately to their intended destination. Then, if that destination is another character or byte stream, flush it. Thus one flush() invocation will flush all the buffers in a chain of Writers and OutputStreams.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface java.io.Flushable
        Specified by:
        flush in class java.io.Writer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the stream, flushing it first. Once a stream has been closed, further write() or flush() invocations will cause an IOException to be thrown. Closing a previously-closed stream, however, has no effect.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in class java.io.Writer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
